body.p:
Louisville Ky
July, 8..1861.
My Dear Ann

I have been run nearly to death since I got here, and have time now only to write you a few lines -- I think for several reasons for my sons, myself and our camp that I had better go on with them to Richmond, from which I can return in a very short time. Rest assured I shall be in no danger what ever --

My Dear Ann, I hope you will improve the time of my absence, to renovate yourself, by cheerful excrcis and enjoyment with your friends -- Stay a great deal with Eliza. ^must^ my remind my little boys of me daily, and may God Almighty, bless and preserve you

Yours affectionate Husband
George W. Johnson
I will arrange to write you from Richmond
